DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate acute effect respiratory muscle stretch ventilator pattern volume distribution chest wall patient right hemiparesis post-stroke hypothesis use RMS able improve change respiratory function .
DOC.brief_title: Acute Effects After Stretching Respiratory Muscles Ventilatory Pattern Volume Distribution Chest Wall
DOC.detailed_description: All study protocol perform three different day . In first day , participant undergo initial assessment , consist anamnesis anthropometric measurement : weight , height body mass index ( BMI ) . Then , submit spirometry respiratory muscle pressure use manovacuometer . All patient submit underwent two type intervention : respiratory muscle stretch ( RMS ) remain rest ( control group ) . The stretch occur throughout expiratory phase allow respiratory muscle reach maximal length , two set 10 consecutive incursion use stretch pattern interval 30 second series . For intervention control group , volunteer position rest comfortable chair 20 minute .
DOC.criteria: patient poststroke right hemiparesis 3 month , sex , age 20 year , score 1 3 accord Ashworth Scale upper limb , score 85 accord Barthel Index minimum punctuation 18 Mini Mental State Examination . Volunteers present facial paralysis ; rheumatic orthopedic disease ; spinal abnormality deformity compromise respiratory mechanic ; spirometry force expired volume first second ( FEV1 ) bellow 80 % predict value FEV1∕forced vital capacity ( FVC ) ≤ .7 ; present respiratory comorbidities ; recent history thoracic abdominal surgery ; hemodynamic instability pregnancy .
